resources.string: Your recovery key gives you access to your vault if you happen to lose access to it.
Your recovery key lets you access your vault if you have lost access to all other logged in devices.
Are you sure you want to turn off this recovery method?
If you turn this off, your existing recovery key will no longer be valid.
Your recovery key is a spare key to your vault
This is a single-use spare key to your vault. If you need to, you can use it to get back into your account and reset your Master Password.
This is a single-use spare key to your vault. If you lose your device or forget your PIN, you can use it to access your account.
If you lose your device or forget your PIN, this key is the only way you can access your account.
Your recovery key is one of the few ways you can access your Dashlane vault if you lose access to it.
For your security, you should write it down and store it offline with other important documents.
You will be asked to confirm this key on the next screen.
The setup of your account recovery key is not completed until you confirm your key.
If you didn’t make a copy of your key in the last step, go back and do that now.
This doesn’t look right. Check the key and try again.
Your recovery key is ready if you need it!
Enter your single-use recovery key to recover access to your account and change your Master Password.
Enter your single-use recovery key to recover access to your account.
This doesn’t look right. Check the key and try again.
You successfully recovered access to your account!
Your recovery key setting was turned off

For your security, we turned this off when your Master Password changed. This means your existing recovery key is no longer valid.\n\nTo generate a new recovery key, turn this on again in your Security settings.
If you have an account recovery key enabled, it will be turned off as a result of this change. To generate a new recovery key, turn this on again in your security settings.
